description:
#RML example 
The first thing to declare in an RML mapping is the subject and, potentially, an rdf:type. For this purpose a rml:logicalSource must be defined speciying where the data is (in our example https://raw.githubusercontent.com/helio-ecosystem/helio-ecosystem/main/resources/mappings-data/ldac/people.csv) and its format (in our example rml:referenceFormulation ql:CSV).
Then, the subject must be defined using rr:subjectMap. For speciying the subject it has to be used the property rr:template that must contain a static part and a dynamic part that points to a column of our data (in this case is a column since we have a CSV). For instance rr:template "http://sample.com/resource/P{ID}".
Finally, the rdf:type is specifyed using the property rr:class and indicating in its range the class itself.
For the mapping below generate subjects with an URL that is http://sample.com/resource/P{ID} and which class is foaf:Person
